Column Comment.0: SEISMIC SET SUBTYPE: the type of seismic set that is referenced. Must be thename of the seis line set that the points belong to.
Column Comment.1: SEISMIC SET: A seismic set is a super type of various types of seismic collections.
Column Comment.2: SEISMIC POINT ID: Unique identifier for each seismic point
Column Comment.3: AQUISITION SEQUENCE NUMBER: Indicates the order in which stations wereacquired during recording.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: BEND INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this point exists at a bend point on theline. Used to calculate positions for stick representations of lines.
Column Comment.6: DATUM ELEVATION: The elevation of the vertical datum used to measure theposition of downhole geophones.
Column Comment.8: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.9: ELEVATION: The elevation of the point relative to the survey system or the TVD(vertial depth) of a pont that is in the subsurface. Most commonly, this will be used forwell related seismic, where source or receiver points may be located in the bore hole.
Column Comment.11: END INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this point exists at the end of a seismicline. A seperate flag is created for BEND points. used to identify the first and lastpoints on a line. First and last may be defined by acquisition order, by direction,orhowever your business rules prefer.
Column Comment.12: EXCEPTION INDICATOR: whether the point is indicated as an exception - not to beincluded as a usual component of the seismic line.
Column Comment.13: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.14: FLOWING HOLE INDICATOR: A Y / N flag indicating whether this point is a flowinghole. For details about the flowing hole and remedial action, refer to the table SEISPOINT FLOW.
Column Comment.15: MAPPING CODE: A code indicating whether stations should be posted or annotatedat each of 8 mapping scales (in this order - 1:10K, 1:25K, 1:50K, 1:75K, 1:125K,1:150K, 1:200K, 1:250K) P=POST ONLY; A=POST AND ANNOTATE at this scale).
Column Comment.16: MEASURED DEPTH: the Measured Depth of the shot or receiver placement, belowground or sea level.
Column Comment.18: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.19: REFERNCE DATUM: the datum to which the elevations or depths have beenreferenced, such as Mean Sea Level.
Column Comment.20: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.21: SEISMIC POINT LABEL: the label or name commonly assigned to the point
Column Comment.22: POINT_LATITUDE: The latitude of the seismic point
Column Comment.23: POINT LONGITUDE: The longitude of the seismic point
Column Comment.24: SEISMIC POINT NUMBER: the numeric value of the seismic point number assignedto a seismic point. Used by processors.
Column Comment.25: SEISMIC STATION TYPE: seismic station type such as CDP, source, receiver etc
Column Comment.26: SOURCE: The individual, company, agency, application or other source designatedas the source of information for this row.
Column Comment.27: SPATIAL SEQUENCE NUMBER: Unique spatial sequence number used to order thepoints on the line spatially. Used for mapping and distance calculations.
Column Comment.28: X COORDINATE: Optional for insertion of a mapping co-ordinate
Column Comment.29: Y COORDINATE: Optional for insertion of a Y co-ordinate for mapping
Column Comment.30: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.31: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.32: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.33: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.34: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.35: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.36: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
